alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Mason (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 12:29AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN MASON AND SOUTHWESTERN LEWIS COUNTIES THROUGH 100 AM EDT... At 1229 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Lewisburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Lewisburg, Tollesboro, Murphysville, Mount Gilead, Mays Lick, Rectorville, Epworth, Ribolt, Peed, Charters, Fleming-Mason Airport, Petersville, Stricklett, Orangeburg, Helena, Glen Springs and Herron Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for northern and northeastern Kentucky. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
